body_html:
I'm deploying Tensorflow so there are lots of modules doing lots of things.
I'm new to all of this so when you say,
[I solved this problem by rearranging things to get rid of all occurrences of "that".]
Is "that" keeping modules from importing each other?
Where does "if name == 'main':" fit in to all this?
Maybe I should drill some basic Python programming, but when I do it feels like I'm not learning how to do anything and nothing is retained. Sorry this is unfocused. Seems futile.

body:
I'm deploying Tensorflow so there are lots of modules doing lots of things.
I'm new to all of this so when you say,
[I solved this problem by rearranging things to get rid of all occurrences of "that".]
Is "that" keeping modules from importing each other?
Where does "if name == 'main':" fit in to all this?
Maybe I should drill some basic Python programming, but when I do it feels like I'm not learning how to do anything and nothing is retained. Sorry this is unfocused. Seems futile.
